player_decision.reason: Three-handed on the button with 9-6 offsuit is a standard open. Min-raise to steal cheaply versus likely-foldy blinds and keep flexibility postflop.
Two hearts and a marginal J-high hand on a heads-up preflop facing a 20 bet. Folding preserves stack for the tournament; equity vs her continuing range is too weak to justify calling/raising.
Kd7h is a marginal hand heads-up; calling 10 to see the flop is cheaper than committing more with a weak offsuit K. Preserve stack and realize equity postflop rather than over-raising preflop.

I have middle pair (7s) with a K kicker on A‑T‑7. I’m behind to Ax and many stronger hands; calling controls the pot, keeps weaker draws and worse pairs in, and lets me reevaluate on the turn. Raising or shoving is unnecessarily risky here.
Monotone A-high board strongly favors a small c-bet as the preflop raiser; our spade blocker reduces flush combos and can fold out many worse hands cheaply.

I have top pair (7s) with a K kicker on As Ts 7s. Alice's small bet (10 into 55) looks like a c-bet or weak value; calling extracts value from worse hands, keeps the pot controlled, and avoids committing when I could be behind to an Ace.

I have a marginal pair (7s) on a highly coordinated board (four spades, A/Q/T present). Too many hands beat me (any spade, A, Q, T). Calling keeps the pot manageable and avoids committing my stack with a vulnerable hand.
We have a weak 6-high flush on a 4-spade board with low SPR. Betting risks a check-shove from higher spades; checking back controls pot and realizes equity, keeping dominated scenarios in check.

I have two pair (Kings and Sevens) on a five-card board — a strong, but vulnerable, value hand. Betting a medium amount extracts value from worse hands (Kx, Qx, missed Ax bluffs) while avoiding committing my entire stack if I’m up against an Ace or a better two-pair. This sizes for value and to charge potential bluffs.

We have a low flush (6s) on a four-spade board. Pot odds (~28%) are favorable and villain can be betting straights or worse spades; raising only isolates higher spades and risks more with little value. Call to realize equity.
